Copying View Labels

Occasionally, you may want to create a view label and attach it to the same item revisions as an existing view label, with a few additions or exceptions. This situation often arises when your company creates a patch for a product release that has already shipped.

Note: You cannot copy a view label unless it already exists in the view in which you are performing this operation. The view configuration must also be current.

To create a view label based on an existing view label (with a few additions or exceptions):

  1. Create a new view label and attach it to the same revisions of items as the existing view label.

    1. Select View > Labels from the menu bar. The Labels dialog opens, with the View tab selected.

    2. Click New. The View Label dialog opens.

    3. Enter a label name (such as Release 1.0-Patch 1) and a description for the label in the appropriate text boxes.

    4. Select the Labeled configuration option button to attach the label to item revisions that have an existing label.

    5. (Optional) By default, all view labels are designated as build labels. If you do not want this label to be a build label clear the Use as build label check box.

    6. (Optional) To freeze the label, select the Frozen check box.

    7. Click OK. The new view label is now attached to the same revisions as the existing label.

  2. Select the files for which the new label must differ (for example, all files used to make a patch). If the files do not have a revision label, select them individually instead of by following the steps below.

    1. Select By Label from the component or context menu. The Select a Label dialog lists all existing labels.

    2. Select the revision label associated with the selected files.

    3. Click OK. Files with this label become selected in the upper pane.

  3. Move the new label to the appropriate file revisions.

    1. Select Labels > Attach from the File or context menu. The Attach a Label dialog lists all existing labels.

    2. Select the new label from the list.

    3. Select the Labeled Configuration option button to adjust the new label to include the revisions in the patch (see Note below).

    4. From the drop-down list box, select the revision label associated with the patch.

    5. Click OK. For the files selected from the upper pane, the new view label is moved to (or added to) the revisions with the selected revision label. The new label differs slightly from the label you copied.

    Note: If the files do not have a revision label but are the tip revisions, select the Current Configuration option button. If the files are not the tip revisions, you may also consider using the Configuration As Of option button.

  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 if you need to adjust the new view label for items other than files.
